meanings.definition: The act of forming words with letters in the correct order.
meanings.sent1: Her spellings were neat and easy to read.
meanings.sent2: The teacher checked the students' spellings for mistakes.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to mimic the spellings on the keyboard, thinking it was a game.
meanings.sent4: His handwriting was like a jumble of spellings, each letter fighting for attention.
meanings.sent5: The spellings on the sign were so clear that even a child could read them.

meanings.definition: Different ways in which a word can be written or spelled.
meanings.sent1: The two spellings of 'color' are 'color' and 'colour'.
meanings.sent2: She was confused by the different spellings of the same word.
meanings.sent3: The spellings on the menu were so creative that they looked like art.
meanings.sent4: The spellings of his name seemed to change every time he wrote it down.
meanings.sent5: The spellings in the old book were so unique that they fascinated linguists.
